Kahovska Power Plant Item Info

Aerial view of the Kahovska power plant machine hall before the war

Ruins of the demolished Kahovska power plant

View on Map
  • Kahovska Power Plant ()
  • Item 1 (JPEG)
  • Item 2 (JPEG)
Title
Kahovska Power Plant
Architect
Georgy Orlov
Description
The machine hall of the Kakhovka hydroelectric power station was incredibly exquisite in architectural terms. Its façade featured Renaissance-revival architectural techniques, while the round porthole windows referred to both the Bauhaus and the rose windows of the Gothic era. As a result of the blowing up of the hydroelectric power station by Russian troops, the machine hall fell apart into several pieces and cannot be restored.
Date of Construction
1952-1955
Date of Destruction
2023-06-06
Subsection
industry
Location
Нова Каховка / Nova Kakhovka
Region
Kherson oblast
Source
Preferred Citation:
"Kahovska Power Plant", Destroyed Ukrainian Heritage - Exhibition, Leibniz Institute for the History and Culture of Eastern Europe (GWZO)
Reference Link:
